intro: Eugenia ibitipocensis, commonly known as the Ibitipocá myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant ecological importance in its native ecosystem.
